name: Apis mellifica
Relationship: Complementary; NAT, MUR. The chronic, APIS.; Also BARYTA CARB., if lymphatics are involved. Inimical. RHUS.Compare: Apium virus (auto-toxaemia, with pus products); Zinc.; Canth.; Vespa; Lachesis.
Modalities: Worse: heat in any form; touch; pressure; late in afternoon; after sleeping; in closed and heated rooms

Urine: Suppressed, loaded with casts; frequent and involuntary; stinging pain and strangury; scanty, high colored
Stool: Cannot urinate without a stool dark, fetid, worse after eating
Hemorrhoids, with stinging pain, after confinement
Involuntary on every motion; anus seems open
Diarrhoea watery, yellow; cholera infantum type
Constipation; feels as if something would break on straining
Head: Heat, throbbing, distensive pains, better on pressure, and worse on motion
Dull, heavy sensation in occiput, as from a blow, extending to neck , accompanied with sexual excitement
Whole brain feels very tired
Vertigo with sneezing, worse on lying or closing eyes
Sudden stabbing pains
Bores head into pillow and screams out
Fever: After perspiration, nettle rash, also with shuddering
Perspiration breaks out and dries up frequently
Afternoon chill, with thirst; worse on motion and heat
Abdomen: Sore, bruised on pressure, when sneezing
Mouth: Membrane of mouth and throat glossy, as if varnished
Tongue feels scalded, red hot, trembling
Red, shining, and puffy, like erysipelas
Tongue fiery red, swollen, sore, and raw, with vesicles
Respiratory: Hoarseness; dyspnea, breathing hurried and difficult
Feels as if he could not draw another breath
Eyes: Lids swollen, red, oedematous, everted, inflamed; burn and sting
Serous exudation, edema, and sharp pains
Staphyloma of cornea following suppurative inflammation
Keratitis with intense chemosis of ocular conjunction
Nose: Red, swollen, inflamed, with sharp pains
Ears: External ear red, inflamed, sore; stinging pains
Mind: Cannot concentrate mind when attempting to read or study
Stupor, with sudden sharp cries and startings
Sleep: Dreams full of care and toil
Screams and sudden startling during sleep
Female: Menses suppressed, with cerebral and head symptoms, especially in young girls
Bearing-down, as if menses were to appear
Great tenderness over abdomen and uterine region
Soreness and stinging pains; ovaritis; worse in right ovary
Oedema of labia; relieved by cold water
Metrorrhagia profuse, with heavy abdomen, faintness, stinging pain
Ovarian tumors, metritis with stinging pains
Skin: Erysipelas, with sensitiveness and swelling, rosy hue
Sudden puffing up of whole body
Extremities: Knee swollen, shiny, sensitive, sore, with stinging pain
Rheumatic pain in back and limbs
Numbness of hands and tips of fingers

details: The very characteristic effects of the sting of the bee furnish unerring indications for its employment in disease. Swelling or puffing up of various parts, EDEMA, red rosy hue, stinging pains, soreness, intolerance of heat, and slightest touch, and afternoon aggravation are some of the general guiding symptoms. Erysipelatous inflammations, dropsical effusions and anasarca, acute, inflammation of kidneys, and other parenchymatous tissues are characteristic pathological states corresponding to Apis. Apis acts especially on outer parts, skin, coatings of inner organs, serous membranes. It produces serous inflammation with effusion, membranes of brain, heart, pleuritic effusion, etc. Extreme sensitiveness to touch and general soreness is marked. CONSTRICTED sensations. Sensation of stiffness and as of something torn off in the interior of the body. Much prostration.Acts on cellular tissues causing oedema of skin and mucous membranes.
dosage: Tincture to thirtieth potency. In oedematous conditions the LOWER potencies. Sometimes action is slow; so several days elapse before it is seen to act, and then urine is increased. APIUM VIRUS, sixth trituration.
